This just in:
 
 Coffee Drinking Associated With Lower Risk For Alcohol-related Liver Disease
 
 Do you think? Could it be instead that people who drink coffee are not drinking alcohol at the time; they are beginning a sober period, giving the liver a much-needed respite. Alcoholics, meanwhile, continue to ingest alcohol, forgoing coffee.
 
 Why is it up to me to figure this out? 
 
 IMO, news reports about the latest health study such as this should be ignored.

And in the category of News You Can't Possibly Live Without:
 
 Monkeys That Drink Heavily Develop Signs Of Liver Disease, Wake Forest Study Shows
 
 
 What the...???

When I heard about this it made me nervous so I embarked on a rigorous coffee-drinking program however I am finding it difficult to sleep at night but I think I can offset this effect with large amounts of alcohol in the evening.

It may help the liver, but too much caffine can effect your body in other ways besides making you unable to sleep...
 Trust me.

It may help the liver, but too much caffine can effect your body in other ways besides making you unable to sleep...
 Trust me.

 Sounds like you are speaking from experience.
 
 Tell us.
